title: East Yorkshire and northern Lincolnshire breaking news: Latest updates - BBC News
summary: jail for man who sparked major evacuation in bridlington .
murder investigation after woman 's death in hull .
urgent appeal to help find missing hull woman .
woman dies in hospital following camerton collision .

documents.title: injury hampers maloney 's dons move
text: injury hampers maloney 's dons move
author: Andy Burke
BBC Sport Scotland

documents.title: castleford 24-22 hull fc
text: castleford 24-22 hull fc

documents.title: five things we learned today
text: that 's all from me for today and , indeed , this week .
we 'll be back on monday from 08:00 with all the latest updates from across east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire .
to end with , here are five of our top stories :
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : weekend weather forecast
text: here 's what to expect from your weather for this weekend :
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: in bbc weather watchers get out and about
text: it 's not been the best of days , weather-wise , today .
but as always our bbc weather watchers have been out and about .
here 's a selection of their shots :
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: reprieve for hull mobility firm facing closure
text: you might remember that earlier this week we told you about the hull mobility scooter hire company facing closure because of a lack of funding .
thankfully , a bbc radio humberside listener has come forward to help travel extra at hull railway station .
the unnamed businessman contacted the organisation to donate money to keep them open , at least in the short term .

documents.title: more investment promised for northern lincolnshire
text: the opening of a £ 93m road improvement scheme near the port of immingham is just the start of investment in the area , according to a government minister .
the work to reduce congestion has been carried out on the a160 and a180 .
transport minister john hayes was at the launch and said the port was `` vital '' to the future economy of the country .
author: Richard Madden
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: hull fc away to castleford tigers
text: hull fc travel to super league leaders castleford tigers tonight , looking to complete a hat-trick of wins over them this season .
the black and whites have beaten them at the kcom in the league and cup .
danny washbrook , who 'll make his 300th career appearance tonight , expects to face a vengeful cas side :
here 's a reminder of our 19-man squad for tonight 's top of the table clash with @ twitterid # coyh
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: man jailed over chemicals stash 'was danger to himself and others '
text: more on the news that a man who caused part of bridlington to be shut down by the bomb squad last august has been sentenced at hull crown court to eight months in prison .
gert meyers says he `` forgot '' to apply for a licence to keep chemicals in his house on oxford street .
he 'd been running an online business selling them .
ian dixon , chief inspector of policing for humberside police , says gert mayers was a danger to himself :
author: Katy Austin
Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: prison for bridlington man who sparked major evacuation
text: a man who caused a large-scale evacuation in the oxford street area of bridlington has been sentenced to eight months in prison , four of those to be served behind bars .
gert meyers , 55 , who had been running an online chemical supply business from his home , pleaded guilty in march to keeping potentially dangerous chemicals without a permit .
police raided meyers ' house on 4 august last year .
he was arrested and neighbouring streets were evacuated while the army 's bomb squad and scientists made the chemicals safe .
meyers had previously been questioned by the police after legally supplying chemicals to two people who were later convicted of terrorism offences .

documents.title: breakingprison for man who caused large scale evacuation in bridlington
text: a man who caused a large-scale evacuation in bridlington has been sentenced to eight months in prison .
gert meyers , who ran an online chemical supply business from his home had earlier pleaded guilty to keeping potentially dangerous chemicals without a permit .
author: Katy Austin
Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: heaton and abbott head for bridlington
text: if you missed paul heaton and jacqui abbott playing at hull 's kcom craven park stadium earlier this month , you 've got the chance to see them again at bridlington spa .
they 're best know for their hits with the beautiful south such as rotterdam , perfect 10 and do n't marry her .
paul heaton came to fame with his band the housemartins in the mid-1980s and has sold over 10m albums over his career .
their latest tour has been announced today ahead of the release of their new album and you can see the pair at the spa on 8 december in bridlington .
author: Chris Arundel
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: former lord mayor of hull dies
text: tributes have been paid to the former lord mayor of hull trevor larsen , who 's died after an illness .
the ex-labour councillor was well known for his work with hull city council 's cultural services committee in the 1990s .
mr larsen was also a key figure in developing hull 's museum quarter .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: no hearts interest in mcgregor - cathro
text: no hearts interest in mcgregor - cathro

documents.title: abuse brothers ' appeal refused
text: two brothers who groomed and abused girls in yorkshire have had an appeal against their convictions rejected .
arshid hussain ( left ) , originally from goole , and his brother basharat ( right ) were part of a grooming gang jailed in 2016 for the `` systematic '' sexual abuse of teenage girls in rotherham .
an application to overturn their convictions for offences , including rape and false imprisonment , was refused at leeds crown court earlier today .
arshid hussain 's appeal to reduce his 35-year sentence was also refused .

documents.title: scunthorpe united 's silence over alexander 's future
text: scunthorpe united have made no public comment so far about manager graham alexander being among the favourites for the vacancy at championship side preston north end .
alexander played for preston for nine years and had a spell as captain and joint caretaker-manager at deepdale .
they 're looking for a replacement for simon grayson , following his move to sunderland .
the bookies reckon it 's between alexander and fleetwood 's uwe rosler .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: new sports centre for crowle
text: work has begun on a new multi-million pound sports centre in north lincolnshire .
the axholme north sports centre in crowle is being built next to the alxholme academy (
it will include a swimming pool , gym , tennis courts and football pitch .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: new custody unit 'wo n't impact other police stations '
text: humberside police have told us their plans for a new custody suite in grimsby wo n't affect other police stations .
they 're proposing to build the suite in the west marsh .
it would replace current custody facilities at grimsby and scunthorpe police stations .
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: major new junction officially opened in immingham
text: a new road junction aimed at improving congestion around the port of immingham has been officially opened by the government 's maritime minister :
highways england has spent over £ 90m on changes to the a160 and a180 , including a new dual carriageway and road bridge for residents .
about 40,000 vehicles are expected to use the new route every day .
author: Caroline Brockelbank
BBC Local Live

documents.title: traffic and travel : train delays around grimsby
text: trains are at a standstill on transpennine express and east midlands trains between barnetby and grimsby at the moment due to a points failure at barnetby :
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: beverley 's kyle edmund heads for wimbledon
text: kyle edmund ( from beverley , will face a qualifier or lucky loser in his first round match at wimbledon next week .
the british number two has never won a match there .
defending champion andy murray will also start against a qualifier or a lucky loser on monday .
murrays the top seed and will begin on centre court , and could potentially face british qualifier and world number 855 alex ward .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: putting hull on the cultural map
text: more than three quarters of a million people have visited attractions in hull since the start of the year , new figures show .
six months since the launch of hull city of culture 2017 , council figures suggest a dramatic increase in visitors to the museums and attractions the authority runs .
and it 's not just art critics who say it 's benefiting the city .
robin ( who lives on hull 's thornton estate , which has been specially lit up for the hull city of culture celebrations , has told me that it 's really brought the community together .
author: Anne-Marie Tasker
Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: grimsby institute ranked 'outstanding '
text: grimsby institute has been ranked as one of the top performing colleges in the country .
education watchdog ofsted has awarded it an `` outstanding '' grade , making it only the second college in this academic year to achieve that across all english further education colleges .

documents.title: woman dies in hospital following collision
text: a woman has died after a crash on the a1033 at camerton in east yorkshire .
the woman , a 73-year-old passenger in a blue vauxhall astra , was involved in the collision at about 16:30 on tuesday 20 june .
she died in hospital on wednesday , police have confirmed .
police are asking for anyone with any information to get in touch .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: urgent appeal to help find missing hull woman sheila williamson
text: a 78-year-old woman with dementia has gone missing from her home in the holderness road area of hull .
sheila williamson was last seen at home on severn street this morning .
police are urgently trying to find her and say local searches have so far been unsuccessful .
if you see sheila please call the 101 number .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: murder investigation in hull
text: five properties are cordoned off on beverley road in hull as a murder investigation gets under way .
three people have been arrested on sus of murder after a woman was attacked in the street .
the man and two women remain in police custody and police are asking anyone who saw anything to get in touch with them .
a murder investigation has been launched after a disturbance outside a flat on beverley road in hull .
a man and two women are in custody
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: watch : vital work which led to new port link road
text: a new junction to serve britain 's busiest port opens today .
work began in 2015 to improve the junction on the a180 for immingham dock and cost nearly £ 100m :
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : the weekend 's weather
text: here 's what you can expect from the weather over the next few days :
author: Owain Wyn Evans
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: join us for today 's live coverage
text: good morning ,
gill here with all the latest updates on your news , weather , travel and sport across northern lincolnshire and east yorkshire on friday 30th june 2017 .
i 'll be with you till 18:00 .
if you want to get in touch with your or stories you can email us , or get in touch by facebook or twitter .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: smoking numbers down in yorkshire
text: tomorrow marks ten years since the smoking ban was introduced in the uk and it 's been revealed that the number of people who smoke in yorkshire and the humber has significantly fallen in recent years .
in 2012 it was thought that 22 % of people in our region smoked but that figure now sits at around 18 % .
author: Adam Pinder-Smith
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: three arrested over street assault death
text: three arrested over street assault death

documents.title: rawsthorne signs new hull fc contract
text: rawsthorne signs new hull fc contract

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: that 's all from me for today , but all your breaking news , sport , travel and weather will continue to be posted here throughout the night .
i 'll be back tomorrow morning from 08:00 .
but for now , here are five things we did n't know this morning :
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: this evening 's weather forecast
text: here 's what to expect from the weather over the next few days :
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: watch : fifty years of hull 's bransholme estate
text: it 's 50 years since the first families moved into hull 's bransholme estate , and every day this week we are looking at a different decade .
today we 're looking back to 1997-2007 .
watch what happens when you ask two bransholme primary school students how old 50 is :
author: Chloe Deakin
BBC East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: concerns grow over missing cleethorpes man
text: there 's concern for the health of a man who 's gone missing from cleethorpes .
ian fieldsend , who 's 42 , has been missing since 08:00 this morning from grimsby road .
police say he 's in need of medication and are asking anyone who may have seen him to call the 101 number .

documents.title: sprinklers to be fitted to scunthorpe high-rise flats
text: the company operating high-rise buildings in north lincolnshire has confirmed it will install sprinkler systems in all of its tower blocks .
housing provider ongo homes is responsible for four blocks in scunthorpe and , following a meeting with its board , it 's now committed to fitting fire sprinklers .
it 's the first council area in east yorkshire and lincolnshire to make the pledge after the devastating grenfell tower fire in london .
the company has now written to all the residents who live in its high-rise buildings , it says .
author: Caroline Bilton
Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: football fixture changes for hull city and scunthorpe united
text: hull city 's yorkshire derby at home to leeds united on saturday 27 january has been moved to a 12:30 kick-off on the same day .
and two of scunthorpe united 's games have also been moved .
the trip to doncaster has been put back 24 hours and will now be played on sunday 17 september .
meanwhile , the easter weekend game away to oxford is now on good friday 30 march .
both games are still 15:00 start times .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: police appeal over wanted hull man
text: police are appealing for information about the whereabouts of hull man leonard high , who 's wanted in connection with a serious assault and criminal damage .
if you know where he is , you 're being asked to call the 101 number or you can call crimestoppers on 0800 555 111 or report any information online to crimestoppers .

documents.title: 'marrs green ' unveiled in hull as world 's favourite colour
text: the world 's favourite colour has been revealed using hundreds of paper aeroplanes in hull :
that colour is known as `` marrs green '' , which was chosen by members of the public in a worldwide vote .
it 's part of the launch of paper city , a new art exhibition centred around the hull fruit market for the city of culture 2017 .
and just in case you thought marrs green actually looks just a little bit blue , here 's the original colour that people voted for online :
author: James Piekos
Reporter, BBC Hull and East Yorkshire

documents.title: have you seen hull man lee sidaway ?
text: concerns are growing for the welfare of a 45-year-old man who 's gone missing from hull .
lee sidaway was last seen at about 10:00 on tuesday in hull city centre .
police say they 're worried as mr sidaway suffers from a pre-existing medical condition .
he 's described as 5ft 6ins tall , of slim build , with shaved grey hair and green eyes .
he was last seen wearing a navy blue polo shirt , navy blue v-neck jumper , navy blue jacket , navy blue trousers , black steel toe cap boots and a black rucksack .
anyone with information is being asked to contact police .

documents.title: all in a day 's work for grimsby firefighters
text: not sure this is an emergency , but perhaps firefighters in grimsby are waiting below to catch any falling fledglings .
loving this photo from humberside fire and rescue :
grimsby , cromwell road fledglings nearly ready to take to the air for the summer .
6 beautiful baby swallows # wildlifephotography
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hull city set to battle it out for kalas
text: hull city are still expecting to face competition for chelsea defender tomas kalas as new head coach leonid slutsky looks to make his first senior signing .
it 's been widely reported that the czech international is a player city are keen to bring to the club .
it 's hoped slutsky 's friendship with blues owner roman abramovich could improve those chances .
however , continued interest from other clubs could scupper a potential deal .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: yorks and surrey draw after washout
text: yorks and surrey draw after washout

documents.title: ultrafast broadband promised for 10,000 homes
text: almost 10,000 more homes in hull and east yorkshire are being promised access to ultrafast broadband by the end of this year .
people living in the longhill , sutton and bilton areas will be able to order the new service over the next month .
it 's part of kcom 's £ 60m investment into ultrafast broadband in the area , the company says .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: leak forces closure of scunthorpe library
text: riddings library on keelby road in scunthorpe has had to close until further notice .
it 's because of a leak in the roof .
north lincolnshire council says the nearest alternative libraries are ashby and bottesford .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cleethorpes gets ready for armed forces day
text: events are being held over the weekend in cleethorpes to recognise the role of the armed fores .
from tomorrow running until sunday there will be parades , performances , fireworks and flyovers .
some of the gear has arrived already :
i wonder where they 're going to park it ?
our first bit of kit has arrived !
the excitement builds for afd weekend # saluteourforces # afdnel # teamafd2017 # cleethorpes # takepartnel
ca n't wait ! ! !
i 'm so so excited xx
haha so it would seem !
# saluteourforces # cleethorpes # afdnel # teamafd2017 wonder if this hero will visit us again this year .
hope to see you again ben
looking forward to another excellent event ! ! !
# teamafd
hope it all goes well !
see these travelling down the m180 this morning
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: leonid slutsky : why i swapped russia national team for hull city
text: leonid slutsky : why i swapped russia national team for hull city

documents.title: hull royal infirmary cladding sent for testing
text: the trust which runs hull royal infirmary has confirmed it has sent samples of cladding for testing in the light of the grenfell tower fire in london .
the material was installed in 2014 , according to hull and east yorkshire hospitals nhs trust .
the trust had previously released statements saying fire protection was incorporated within the cladding and would prevent a blaze from moving across floors at the building .
the results of the tests are due next week and the trust said `` the safety of everyone using the hospital is of utmost importance to us '' .
in accordance with guidance set out by nhs improvement , cladding samples have been sent away for testing .
based on the information obtained to date , we can confirm that the cladding on the hull royal infirmary tower block is not the same as that used on the grenfell tower block . ''
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: humberside police gets a new recruit
text: meeting colleagues on the first day of the job for this new recruit for humberside police :
have just been introduced to a new recruit , toby .
pc matthews showing him arround the station this afternoon .
hello toby you look beautiful .
i once had a dog called toby he was beautiful too .
he was a corgi !
good luck from one toby to another
oh toby your gourgous x , is it me or are police officers getting more furry and younger ?
oh toby you are a wee dote !
oh my god he 's gorgeous
oh dear lord .
it 's just as well i 'm not in charge of pd toby 's induction .
i would have patted him bald by now .
such a gorgeous dog .
# woof
awwwr he 's lovely
oh what a little beauty !
what an adorable dog
i want this
cuteness overload .
hi there toby .
aaawww
so gorgeous
you are gorgeous
such a beautiful boy ! !
good luck , toby
adorable
# newrecruit # policefamily # dogoftheday @ twitterid
omg how handsome is he x
very sweet !
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: an east yorkshire ' your own ' business with a difference
text: we 've all heard of your own strawberries but an east yorkshire grower is planning to take the concept a step further , by launching a your own flowers business .
next year gill hodgson from everingham will become just the second commercial grower in yorkshire to offer the option to select your own flowers .
gill says customers will be able to choose their own blooms from the one acre site .
author: Chris Arundel
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: here 's homage to hull
text: have a look at this hull-influenced
how many hull things can you see ?
we love this painting in homage to # hull2017 from @ twitterid can you spot all the nods to our great city ?
any prints available ?
not at the moment but possibly in the future
put me on the list , please .
grand work , indeed !
thank you for letting my work be a wee part of it .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: this afternoon 's weather forecast
text: this afternoon will be rather cloudy , cool and damp , with a northerly breeze and spells of rain .
however , the rain will gradually become lighter and increasingly patchy as the afternoon wears on .
the top temperature will be about about 16c ( 61f ) :
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: hull fc 's michaels 'out for two to three weeks '
text: steve michaels is set to miss two to three weeks with an ankle injury he suffered in the win over wakefield , hull fc has confirmed .
michaels ( had already been ruled out of friday 's trip to castleford and coach lee radford says it 'll be for more than just that game .
meanwhile , radford wo n't confirm if former prop mickey paea is set for a return to the club .
paea , who also played for hull kr during his time in super league , has recently been linked with a move back to the black and whites , having left at the end of 2015 .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: hull university 's oldest building renamed and refurbished after £ 5m legacy
text: after a closure lasting nine months , the building formerly known as staff house at hull university has been reopened following a £ 7m redevelopment .
it 's is one of the oldest university buildings , dating back to 1948 , and is named canham turner after a former student who left a £ 5.3m donation to the university in her will in 2015 .
the refurbishment is part of a £ 200m investment which will include refurbishing the brynmor jones library and a new £ 28m health campus , which opens this summer .
author: Sally Fairfax
BBC Radio Humberside Live

documents.title: green is the colour !
text: thousands of paper helicopters have been released on humber street in hull to reveal the world 's favourite colour , according to a global survey .
and here it is :
this is the world 's favourite colour apparently well i like it @ twitterid 1.30 # hullpaper
you are bang on trend who knew ?
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: what 's the world 's favourite colour ? we 're about to find out
text: the `` world 's favourite colour '' - at least according to the findings of a global survey - is due to be announced in hull shortly .
as part of paper city , an exhibition in hull featuring large paper installations , the results of a survey of over 100 countries will be announced .
the winning colour will be revealed when thousands of paper helicopters in the winning colour rain down from the sky .
author: David Harrison
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: big weekend returns as bbc radio 3 prepares to revisit hull 's history
text: the bbc is coming back to hull with another big weekend - but this time it 's the radio 3 big chamber weekend .
four concerts will be broadcast live from the middleton hall at hull university from friday 7 july .
there will be music from schubert to britten and shostakovich covering the history of hull including the blitz , the north sea and william wilberforce .
more details of performances and tickets can be found here .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: views sought over police plans for new grimsby custody suite
text: local residents in grimsby are being asked for their views on humberside police 's plans to build a new custody suite in the town .
the suite would replace current custody facilities at grimsby and scunthorpe police stations , which the force says are outdated .
the police stations themselves would continue to operate , the force says .
a public information session is being held today at the west marsh community centre in grimsby .

documents.title: review follows mental health unit patient incident
text: a health board is to carry out a review after a patient absconded to north lincolnshire from a scottish mental health unit .
it sparked a major police operation in the town last week before the man was eventually traced in scunthorpe .
the public was warned not to approach the missing midpark hospital patient and children kept in some schools .
nhs dumfries and galloway said it would be looking at the circumstances of the incident and aim to `` minimise the likelihood '' of it being repeated .

documents.title: happy birthday to cleethorpes rnli
text: the rnli lifeboat station in cleethorpes is celebrating 30 years of saving lives .
it was on this day in 1987 the station was declared `` on service '' .
in that time volunteer crews have launched nearly 1,200 times , rescued almost 800 people and saved more than 240 lives .
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: world cycling championships to come to beverley
text: the world 's best cyclists will be heading to beverley in 2019 as plans for the union cycliste internationale ( uci ) world championships head to yorkshire .
part of the race is expected to start in beverley .
it 's hoped it 'll build on the success of the tour de france in 2014 and the tour de yorkshire .
it 's thought the race will finish in harrogate and other start location could include leeds , doncaster and york .
author: Chris Arundel
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: scunthorpe tower block safety calls
text: assurances are being sought that tower blocks in north lincolnshire are safe following the grenfell tower disaster in london .
today it 's expected that the retired appeal court judge sir martin moore-bick , will be appointed to lead the public inquiry into the grenfell tower disaster .
north lincolnshire council will also seek assurances from housing provider ongo and humberside fire and rescue that the tower blocks in the area are safe .
in hull , the council says if anyone has any concerns about living in high-rise flats in the city they should contact them on 01482 300 300 or email hs-communications @ hullcc.gov.uk .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : cool and damp
text: here 's my full forecast for the day ahead :
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: join us for today 's live coverage
text: good morning , gill here with the latest news , weather , sport and travel across east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire throughout the day until 18:00 .
it 's looking like it 's going to be another wet day across the region as this from one of our weather watchers shows :
if you want to send us your or stories you can get in touch via email , facebook or twitter .

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: that 's all from me for today , but all your breaking news , sport , travel and weather will continue to be posted here throughout the night .
i 'll be back tomorrow morning from 08:00 .
but for now here are five things we did n't know this morning :
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : a cool and damp forecast
text: here 's a look at the weather over the next few days for east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire :
author: Alina Jenkins
BBC Weather

documents.title: watch : hull 's bransholme estate at 50
text: it 's 50 years since the first families moved into hull 's bransholme estate and every day this week we are looking at a different decade .
today we 're starting in 1987 and asking if you remember perronet thompson school ?
bransholme resident tess certainly does :
author: Chloe Deakin
BBC East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: racegoers in beverley to be given free sunscreen
text: after the recent hot weather ( but not this week ) , beverley racecourse has teamed up with yorkshire cancer research to give away free sun tan lotion to spectators and staff .

the idea is to raise awareness of the dangers of skin cancer and there 'll be free sun tan lotion dispensers around the racecourse and wristbands will also be available which will tell you if you need to cover up .
the scheme is being launched at the race meeting on friday 7 july and money raised from the wristbands will go to yorkshire cancer research .

documents.title: industrial development zone in stallingborough up for grabs
text: up to 2,000 jobs could be created in a new industrial development site in stallingborough .
the portlink 180 site is part of the humber enterprize zone and has been allocated for storage , distribution or light industrial uses .
the site is now for sale and will include warehouse and industrial facilities which can be leased .

documents.title: listen : culture proves a hit for hull
text: new figures show 90 % of people who live in hull have taken part in city of culture 2017 events so far this year .
the research , carried out by the university of hull , shows there 've been over 1.4m visits to events in total during the first six months of hull 2017 .
martin green ( chief executive of hull city of culture , says it 's the people of hull who are really making the year a success :

documents.title: pet owners warned over dog chipping websites
text: east yorkshire 's dog owners are being warned about bogus dog chipping websites .
several sites which charge about £ 15 to update dogs ' chip information but do n't actually make any changes have been discovered by east riding of yorkshire council .
dogs have to be microchipped by law and it is an offence not to keep your details up to date .
the authority is urging dog owners to check the websites they use are genuine .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headingley suffers third-day washout
text: headingley suffers third-day washout

documents.title: warning over dangerous selfies at dilapidated hull landmark
text: children are risking their lives trespassing in a dilapidated former trawler company building in hull in a bid to take selfies and videos , police have warned .
a total of 18 teenagers have been escorted off the site of the lord line building in the last month , say police .
as the asbestos-riddled building continues to decay , it 's attracting more and more youngsters , according to police .
manor property says it 's spent hundreds of thousands of pounds securing the site , but officers are now patrolling it every day to stop people putting their lives at risk for the sake of a selfie .
author: Jill Archbold
Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: witness appeal over rape in goole
text: police are appealing for help in their investigation into a rape in goole in which an 18-year-old woman was attacked on her way home last month .
it happened at about 03:30 on monday 1 may and the cctv image above was captured by an associated british ports camera .
police say they want to speak to the woman in the who was wearing a long white scarf .
anyone with any information is being asked to contact police .

documents.title: flood warning for bridlington this evening
text: a flood warning remains in place in bridlington for this evening 's high tide .
that means flooding is expected so immediate action is required .
wave overtopping is expected to cause some flooding around the north harbour area between 19:45 and 22.30 :
this morning 's high tide around harbour road and floral pavilion caused waves to come over the top of the sea wall :
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hull estate 's yellow lines spark anger among residents
text: people living on a new housing estate in hull say they 're unhappy about double yellow lines which they say have mysteriously appeared overnight .
residents of the ings estate say they 're annoyed the council 's decided to paint the lines in front of their homes on perivale close , meaning there 's nowhere to park vehicles nearby .
hull city council says it did post notices about the yellow lines and got no objections .
the authority adds it 'll now meet residents to discuss their concerns :
it says there is a specific reason for having placed the yellow lines where they are :
all developments are assessed to ensure that emergency services can gain access and that people have free movement of access in those streets .
the assessment showed that vehicles would need to be kept clear in the areas identified by the yellow lines . ''
author: James Piekos
Reporter, BBC Hull and East Yorkshire

documents.title: one hull of a city , one hull of a year and it 's not over yet
text: a total of 90 % of people from hull have been to see a city of culture event since the start of the year , according to figures published today .
but they are n't alone - 342,000 people came along to see the opening made in hull event and visits to the maritime museum and ferens art gallery are up over 500 % year on year .
here are the hull city of culture 2017 highlights so far :
it 's been quite e
it 's been quite a busy but the best is yet to come is n't it let 's have it .
# wearehull # hull2017 # culture
is there going to be a dvd of the year from start to finish ?
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

documents.title: talks held over police officer boost for humberside force
text: the newly-appointed chief constable of humberside police , lee freeman , has tweeted that talks are under way about getting more new police officers in place and quicker :
chief constable lee freeman took was officially confirmed in his new role on monday .
one of his promises was to recruit 300 new officers over the next 12 to 18 months .
those recruits are due to be taken on over the next three years .
inspectors have said the number of frontline staff in the force has fallen by 21 % since 2010 .
really positive meeting with our training inspector discussing our recruitment of additional police officers over next 18 months .

documents.title: culture city 'raises bar for successor '
text: culture city 'raises bar for successor '

documents.title: a cloudy and wet afternoon
text: this afternoon will remain cloudy and wet with the rain turning heavy at times .
it will also feel cool in the brisk winds , especially along the coast and also across the yorkshire wolds .
the top temperature will be about 14c ( 57f ) :
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: in wild seas at bridlington as flood warning remains in place
text: a flood warning at bridlington 's harbour road and floral pavilion remains in place .
that means that flooding is expected and immediate action is required .
here are some of the rough seas around north harbour a little earlier .
not your ty summer 's day
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: listen : open-top bus tours planned for hull
text: you 'll soon be able to get an open-top bus tour around hull city centre .
east yorkshire motor services plans to run the tours from the start of the school summer holidays .
you 'll be able to see queen victoria square , the marina , the deep and the museum quarter as part of the tour .
claire robinson , from eyms , says it 'll be a proper round-trip of the city 's landmarks and places of interest .

documents.title: illegal cigarettes 'sniffed ' out in grimsby
text: almost 33,000 illegal cigarettes and 1.6kg of rolling tobacco have been seized in a raid in grimsby .
trading standards officers used a sniffer dog to uncover the haul in three shops and a flat on freeman street and a flat on the willows estate .
it 's part of a series of crackdowns which have taken place since 2014 .
in that time almost 650,000 illegal cigarettes and 665kg of rolling tobacco have been seized in 70 raids .
the estimated street value of the latest raid is over £ 8,000 and would have cost over £ 20,000 to buy legitimately .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: city of culture visitor figures 'impressive '
text: figures showing the number of visitors attending cultural events and activities in hull during the first three months of city of culture have been `` impressive '' , the uk city of culture body says .
hull university 's interim findings show 1.4m people attended city of culture events , and a third of these included visits to the city 's museums and galleries .
hull was awarded city of culture status in november 2013 , beating competition from swansea , leicester and dundee .
uk city of culture independent advisory panel chairman phil redmond says hull has `` raised the bar '' for its 2021 successor .
these impressive figures indicate both value and the impact of being the uk city of culture , while vindicating the panel 's decision to award the title to hull . ''
author: Pritti Mistry
BBC News Online

documents.title: hull firm affected by global ransomware attack
text: hull-based reckitt benkiser is one of the companies across the globe which has been hit by a major ransomware cyber-attack .
the virus , the source of which is not yet known , freezes the user 's computer and demands an untraceable ransom be paid in the digital bitcoin currency .
consumer goods giant reckitt benckiser says it 's `` marshalled significant resources to rectify the situation as soon as possible '' .

however , in a statement on the firm 's website , it adds : `` although we are working round the clock to minimise the impact on customers and suppliers , we do anticipate that some markets will experience delays in shipping and invoicing .
`` we hope to be in a position to resolve this as soon as possible . ''

documents.title: emergency road closure in goole
text: if you 're in goole at the moment , or heading in that direction , be aware that you may face delays as fire crews deal with a dangerous chimney :
control - crews are removing a dangerous chimney in alexandra st , goole .
aerial appliance in use , road closed for some time .
# redwatch
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: wild weather on the north sea coast
text: it 's looking a bit stormy on the east coast this morning .
one of our weather watchers sent in this of the waves overtopping in hornsea .
what 's it like where you live ?
send us your
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hull mobility centre could close
text: a group which helps people with disabilities get around hull city centre could close due to financial issues .
travelextra hires mobility scooters to about 200 people a month at hull paragon station .
a funding crisis means it could close its doors next month .

documents.title: city of culture nets over 1.7 million visitors to hull so far
text: figures out this morning show how many people from hull are going to events for the city of culture year , and things are looking good
hull city of culture chief executive martin green says he 's astounded that nine out of 10 people who live in hull have been to an event linked to the city of culture year .
the figures come from research by the university of hull , which also shows more than 1.4 million people have visited an event in 2017 .
a total of 70 % of people living in hull think the city of culture year is having a positive impact on the city , the statistics also show .
author: Lizzie Rose
BBC Radio Humberside

text: a very unsettled day ahead with persistent and heavy rain .
here 's my forecast for the next few days :

BBC Weather

text: a flood warning is in place along the coast at bridlington this morning , meaning flooding is expected and immediate action is required .
harbour road and floral pavilion are at risk of waves overtopping from 08:45 to 10:00 during this morning 's high tide .
there are also flood alerts in place at withernsea , easington and kilnsea , the north sea coast from whitby to filey and around bridlington .
a flood alert means flooding is possible , so be prepared .

BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: weather : rain through the night
text: it 'll be cloudy this evening , with an area of persistent and heavy rain spreading northwards and continuing through the night .
and there 's more of the same again tomorrow , with rain for much of the day .
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: watch : listen to the sounds of the humber estuary
text: from the quiet of spurn point to the buzz of hull fair , audio recordist and musician chris watson has been capturing the sounds of the humber estuary .
he spent 18 months travelling the length of the estuary recording 60 hours of noise .
he has produced a 20-minute composition with 20 speakers creating a sphere of sound .
here 's just a taster :

documents.title: plans for new custody suite in grimsby
text: plans to build a new custody suite to replace the existing ones at grimsby and scunthorpe police stations have been unveiled by humberside police .
the force says it 's planning to build the facility close to the a180 in grimsby .
it says the existing police stations will stay open .
a drop-in session is being held at the west marsh community centre on thursday where residents can find out more about the plans .

documents.title: possible signings look at us in new light - scunthorpe boss
text: scunthorpe united return for pre-season training today , and the club 's finding it easier to sign better players after their third place finish last season , according to chairman peter swann .
the club 's hopeful of bringing in two or three more in the next few weeks and swann says players ' perceptions of the league one club have been changed .

he says : `` the one thing that 's certainly apparent this year is that because of our performance last year a lot of players look at us now as an ambitious club which wants to get into the championship .
that is a success . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: watch : bransholme at 50 - dave and his chippy van
text: the bransholme estate in hull is 50-years-old this year .
to celebrate , we 've been speaking to residents past and present about life on the estate .
it 's part of a special project called bransholme : the faces of 50 years .
today , we meet dave on his fish and chip van :
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: new life for an old library in grimsby
text: a library in north east lincolnshire which was threatened with closure has been given a new lease of life .
today the team at the old grant thorold library in grimsby have opened the tea in the park cafe at the community hub .
nathan taylor runs it and says the support they 've had from local residents has been fantastic .
`` we 've been absolutely overwhelmed with the community coming to see us .
we did a 'soft opening ' last wednesday and it 's not stopped since , '' says mr taylor .

documents.title: recognise these power tools ?
text: humberside police say these tools have been found in hull this afternoon .
officers are asking anyone who has had their tools stolen in preston road to get in touch :
power tools found at 13:30pm today on preston road .
have any workmen on the estate or resident had any tools stolen and recognise these ?

and now lincoln city are back in the football league there are some big local games in the mix .
this afternoon it 's been decided that the lincoln v grimsby derbies will also be moved forward .
here 's the latest from bbc radio lincolnshire 's sports reporter rob makepeace :
the 2 lincolnshire derbies between @ twitterid and @ twitterid have been brought forward to 1pm kick offs on police advice .
5,000 of our fans do n't know who grimsby are

documents.title: breakingflood warning issued for bridlington
text: a flood warning has been issued for bridlington on wednesday morning .
the environment agency says wave overtopping is expected to cause some flooding in the area around the north harbour between 08:45 and 10:00 on wednesday .
a flood warning means flooding is expected and immediate action is required .
there are also flood alerts in place for bridlington , withernsea , easington and kilnsea , which means flooding is possible and people in the area need to be prepared .
click here for the latest from the flood warning information service .

documents.title: goalkeeper on trial with grimsby town
text: chelsea trainee and norwich city goalkeeper ben killip has joined grimsby town on trial , the club has confirmed .
the mariners say the 21-year-old trained with the team today .
but the club says goalkeeper coach andy warrington is looking at other options in the next few days .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: hull 'gig theatre ' group wins £ 600k funding
text: a young theatre company from hull will get £ 600,000 over the next four years from the arts council , it 's been announced .
middle child theatre ( has recently been performing to sell-out audiences at hull 's welly nightclub , with its `` gig theatre '' production all we ever wanted was everything .
the funding is part of a £ 157m investment in arts projects across yorkshire and lincolnshire .
and it looks like they are pretty chuffed about it :

documents.title: river hull targeted as part of £ 25m maritime attractions boost
text: here 's a look at what hull 's north end shipyard could look like after a planned multi-million pound redevelopment :

it 's one of the areas targeted as part of a £ 27m investment in the city 's maritime attractions which has been announced today , funded by a £ 15m heritage lottery fund grant and £ 12.5m of council investment .
the dock will be the new home of the arctic corsair trawler , hull 's last sidewinder trawler , which will be restored as part of the project .
leader of hull city council , stephen brady , says : `` this investment will allow the city to celebrate and reflect on its past , present and future as yorkshire 's maritime city '' .

documents.title: man assaulted by cyclist in grimsby
text: a man 's recovering after being assaulted by a cyclist in grimsby .
the 57-year-old was left with minor injuries following the attack on cromwell road at about 11:00 on monday .
the cyclist shouted at the man before assaulting him and leaving his bike behind , officers believe .
anyone who saw what happened is being asked to contact the police .

documents.title: weather : rain on the way with possibility of sunshine
text: it 's looking like a mostly cloudy afternoon with some outbreaks of rain , which could be heavy and prolonged .
we might see some some brighter intervals , but they will be limited .
feeling cool , with highs of 14c ( 57f ) .
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: leconfield flypast marks 72 squadron centenary
text: a special formation of raf tucano aircraft is expected to fly over the former site of raf leconfield later today .
it 's to mark the centenary of 72 squadron , the last remaining raf squadron to have flown spitfires in world war two .
the tucanos are due to fly over all but two of the squadron 's former bases .
72 squadron was founded in july 1917 and was involved in the battle of britain in 1940 .
today 's fly-over is due to take place just after 15:30 this afternoon .

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: the latest stories from east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire so far today include :
author: Richard Madden
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: £ 300k cash injection for lincolnshire arts group
text: a north lincolnshire arts organisation which aims to support the work of local artists has been awarded a £ 300,000 cash boost .
the money , from the arts council , has been awarded to the waterside artists co-operative and is part of a £ 157m injection for arts organisations across yorkshire and lincolnshire .
the co-operative runs the ropewalk in barton upon humber , an arts centre which houses three galleries and 12 artists ' workshops .
the centre , based in a formery ropery building , a grade ii-listed structure which is a quarter of a mile long , is said to attract about 20,000 visitors per year .
here 's the happy reaction from the ropewalk :
phew , 4 years core funding from ace and spectacular news of a capital grant to enable us to buy the ropewalk .
liz our md is a bit emotional !
excellent !
well deserved .
now you can sleep !
congratulations from us all - excellent news for you !
super duper .
looking forward to all those arty events .
stock up on the shepherds watch .
congratulations to you all !
well done guys !
hurray !
wonderful news !
congratulations !

documents.title: hull will become 'world-class visitor destination ' - council leader
text: a £ 27m investment in hull 's maritime attractions is a huge vote of confidence in the city , according to the leader of hull city council .
the money will go towards developing sites including the maritime museum and the historic vessels , the arctic corsair and spurn lightship
the arctic corsair , hull 's last sidewinder trawler , will be moved to a dry dock at the north end shipyard and used to host tours .
the work will be funded by a £ 15m heritage lottery fund grant and £ 12.5m of council investment .
today 's announcement is another major step towards achieving one of the key ambitions of our city plan to make hull a world-class visitor destination . ''

documents.title: hull fire engine gets pride make-over
text: one of hull 's fire engines has been given a bit of a make-over .
the humberside fire and rescue truck has been given a new design to celebrate pride in hull - and the first ever uk pride event which is coming to the city next month .
it celebrates 50 years since homosexuality was decriminalised in the uk .

documents.title: earlier kick-off for stags v mariners
text: mansfield town 's home game against grimsby town has been brought forward by two hours on the advice of police .
the league two match will now kick off at 13:00 on 9 september .
yesterday it was announced both of mansfield 's games against chesterfield this season will also be 13:00 kick-offs following police advice .

documents.title: humber arts to benefit from £ 27m cash boost
text: there 's been another announcement of funding coming to the humber region this morning , following news of a £ 27m cash injection for hull 's maritime attractions .
this time it 's an investment of more than £ 9m over the next four years from the arts council .
middle child theatre ( artlink hull , freedom festival arts trust , hull city council and hull truck theatre will all benefit from the funding .
pocklington arts centre , the junction in goole and the waterside artists cooperative in barton will also get money .

pete massey , the arts council 's north director says : `` we know that art and culture can transform lives and places and we want more people across yorkshire to be able to enjoy and take part in cultural activities . ''

documents.title: fears grow over health of missing woman
text: concerns are growing for the safety and health of a woman from hornsea who 's been missing from her home since last week and may now be in west yorkshire .
sarah broderick was last seen in rolston at about 08:30 on saturday morning and it 's thought she may have travelled to leeds .
police say they 're particularly worried because she is in need of medication which is now well overdue .
sarah 's described as 5ft 8ins tall , of medium build with light brown hair , and she was last seen wearing all black clothing and carrying a pink handbag .
anyone with information about her whereabouts is being asked to contact police as soon as possible .

documents.title: watch : hull maritime investment - where the money will be spent
text: hull 's maritime attractions are to undergo a full restoration , thanks to a £ 27m investment by the city council and heritage lottery fund .
here 's a look at where the money will be spent :
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: your headlines this morning
text: the latest news for east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire :
author: Sally Fairfax
BBC Radio Humberside Live

documents.title: hull makes top three 'alternative city breaks '
text: in 2015 , hull was named in a survey as the least romantic city in the country , but two years later the tables have turned .
the city has been named in the top three alternative city breaks by travel guide company rough guide .
hull was behind manchester and bristol , but was above derby and belfast , which made up the rest of the top five .
it follows a mention in other lists too , with hull recently making it into a top 10 emerging destinations list , with the city coming in ninth place .

documents.title: consumer group says ne lincs is well connected
text: how are the internet speeds in your area ?
well if you live in north east lincolnshire , your broadband is among the fastest in the country , according to the consumer organisation which ?
it comes four years after a campaign by north east lincolnshire residents to improve internet speeds in the area .
author: Suzy Lawson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: £ 27m boost for hull 's maritime attractions
text: there 's some more exciting news for hull this morning : the city council says more than £ 27m is going to be spent on renovating the hull 's maritime attractions to secure the city 's future as a major uk tourist destination .
some of the money will be used to build a new home for the trawler arctic corsair , which tells the story of hull 's fishing industry .
there will also be improvements to the maritime museum ( including the creation of a viewing area in one of the domes at the top of the building .
a total of £ 15m has been awarded from the heritage lottery fund and the city council is putting a further £ 12.5m into the programme .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: weather : cloudy with outbreaks of rain
text: if you 've cast aside your coat and umbrella recently , it 's time to dig them out again !
there 's rain on the way today .
lisa gallagher has the forecast :
good morning east yorkshire and lincolnshire !
here 's your forecast
author: BBC Weather

i 'm suzy and i 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport , weather and travel updates from across the area until 18:00 .
if you want to get in touch , send me an email , or a message on facebook or twitter

documents.title: carer jailed for stealing from 102-year-old
text: a `` merciless '' carer who stole nearly £ 290,000 from a 102-year-old woman has been jailed for nine years .
julie sayles , 59 , from bridlington in east yorkshire , bought two houses with money she took from a bank account she shared with edith negus .
she was found guilty of six charges at hull crown court , including fraud by abuse of position .
one of the properties she bought was in trowbridge , wiltshire , and the other in scarborough , north yorkshire .

text: that 's it from me today , but i 'll be back in the morning from 08:00 with all your latest news , sport , travel and weather from across east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire .
meanwhile , this page will be updated with any breaking news overnight .
before i go , here are five things we have learned today :
bye for now .

documents.title: weather : rain on the way for end of june
text: uh-oh .
we may have had record temperatures this month , but it 's not looking too great for the end of june
we 're looking at showers for the rest of the week , with some cooler temperatures .
it 's all thanks to this area of low pressure :

Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: watch : hull 's `` posh puddles '' unveiled
text: hull 's trinity square has undergone a major £ 25m transformation which has just been unveiled .
it now has eight `` mirror pools '' reflecting hull minister :
author: Amanda White
BBC East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : residents tell the story of hull 's bransholme estate
text: the bransholme estate in hull is 50-years-old this year .
built on farmland and a former raf station , bransholme is home to about 20,000 people .
to mark the anniversary , bbc look north has been there to speak to residents past and present to hear about their experiences of living on the estate .
about 3,000 people contributed to bransholme : the faces of 50 years , including jean higgins :
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch out for hull 's ( in ) visible dancers
text: if you 're walking through hull city centre over the next couple of days , you might spot some seemingly ordinary people suddenly breaking into dance .
do n't be alarmed though , it 's all part of a production called ( in ) visible dancing and is part of the hull city of culture 2017 celebrations .
more and more dancers will take part as the week progresses and it 'll culminate in a big finale in victoria square on saturday 1 july :
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

documents.title: carer jailed for defrauding woman , 102
text: carer jailed for defrauding woman , 102

documents.title: your headlines this evening
text: the latest news for east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire :
author: Sophia Ewen
BBC Radio Humberside News

documents.title: teenager arrested following suspected knife incident
text: a teenager has been arrested on sus of affray following an alleged knife incident in grimsby at the weekend .
officers were called to reports that a man was on willingham street in the town with a knife .
they say officers found a number of men arguing , and a 16-year-old boy from grimsby was arrested .

documents.title: freedom parades to take place in east yorkshire towns
text: more than 100 soldiers are due to march through beverley and bridlington later this week .
soldiers from 2nd battalion , the yorkshire regiment will exercise their freedom rights in the towns on friday .
it means they have the right to parade through the towns with their bayonets fixed , colour flying and bands playing .
the event will start at about 11:00 at new walk in beverley and at about 14:30 at bridlington spa .

documents.title: carer fraud : family of 102-year-old victim speak of 'devastation '
text: the family of a 102-year-old bridlington woman say they were devastated after finding out her carer had stolen thousands of pounds from her and persuaded her to change her will .
julie sayles , 59 , of sewerby road , bridlington , has been sentenced to nine years in prison after she bought two houses with money she took from a bank account she shared with edith negus .
sayles was convicted of six charges at hull crown court , including fraud by abuse of position , as well as making a fraudulent will and presenting it to a solicitor .
speaking on behalf of the family outside hull crown court , ann ruthuen ( a great-niece of ms negus , who died in 2014 , said :
edith was a beautiful , kind , lovely woman who had many family and friends who loved her dearly .
this investigation has been stressful , causing anxiety and it has devastated many of us .
we have been unable to grieve for aunt edith . ''

documents.title: tennis : kyle edmund loses in the first round at eastbourne
text: east yorkshire tennis player kyle edmund has suffered a first-round defeat by american donald young at eastbourne .
young , the world number 47 , registered a 6-4 3-6 6-3 victory over edmund in just over two-and-a-half hours .
edmund , 22 from tickton , has lost 13 of his past 16 matches on the grass courts .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: driffield shop broken into twice in a week
text: a mobile phone shop in driffield has had thousands of pounds worth of stock stolen after being broken into twice in one week .
thieves targeted the shop on market place overnight on sunday 18 june and again on friday 23 june , according to humberside police .
officers say cash and sim cards worth more than £ 5,000 were stolen .

documents.title: police and crime commissioner : new chief offers `` hope for the future ''
text: humberside police 's new chief constable is the `` right person '' to take on the job , according to police and crime commissioner keith hunter .
the humberside police and crime panel confirmed the appointment of lee freeman earlier today .
mr hunter says mr freeman `` offers real hope for the future '' as the force faces future challenges :
lee is a native of the humber area and shares my ambition for both our communities and the police force that serves them . ''

documents.title: breakingcarer jailed for stealing thousands from 102-year-old
text: a carer from bridlington who stole £ 290,000 from a 102-year-old woman has been sentenced to nine years in prison .
jule sayles , 59 , of sewerby road , bridlington , also persuaded edith negus ( - who died in 2014 - to change her will .
she was found guilty by a jury at hull crown court earlier .

documents.title: 'mirror pools ' give a new view of hull minster
text: here 's a look at the new `` mirror pools '' in hull 's trinity square which are specially designed to reflect different angles of hull minster :
the eight pools have been installed as part of a £ 25m refurbishment of the city centre squar which has been officially opened this afternoon .

documents.title: weather : a cloudier afternoon , but staying dry for most
text: it was a lovely morning across east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire , but is it going to last ?
thanks to bbc weather watcher rarelesserspotted for this summery photo from welton in east yorkshire :
sadly , it looks like things could get a bit cloudier this afternoon - but it should stay dry for most :
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: the latest news for east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire :
author: Sophia Ewen
BBC Radio Humberside News

documents.title: appeal after girls , 12 , hit by moped in barton
text: police area appealing for witnesses after two 12-year-old girls were left injured after being hit by a moped in barton upon humber last month .
the girls suffered minor cuts and bruises in the incident on preston lane , near the junction of caistor road , on thursday 25 may .
anyone who saw what happened is being asked to contact police .

documents.title: local policing is priority - new chief constable
text: the new chief constable of humberside police , lee freeman , says he 's committed to increasing the number of officers on the region 's streets .
he has given his first interview to bbc radio humberside after taking up the role this morning .
mr freeman said he wants to increase officer numbers in the next 12 to 18 months and said local policing is a priority :
local policing should be about local officers who are working day in , day out , dedicated to the their local areas , where the public know them .
they know them by name and they know the public , because they work their patch every day . ''
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: breakingbridlington carer found guilty of stealing from 102-year-old woman
text: a former charity worker from bridlington has been found guilty of stealing more than £ 290,000 from a 102-year-old woman .
julie sayles , 59 , of sewerby road , bridlington , has been found guilty at hull crown court of fraud by abuse of position , as well as making a fraudulent will and presenting it to a solicitor .
during her trial , the court heard that she persuaded edith negus to change her will to benefit her
she also bought two houses with money she took from a joint bank account she shared with mrs negus , the court was told .
she is due to be sentenced this afternoon .

documents.title: one minute 's silence in tribute to london mosque attack victims
text: a minute 's silence will be held across the country at midday in remembrance of those affected by the terrorist attack at finsbury park in london last week .
people were leaving prayers when a van was driven into worshippers near the mosque in the early hours of last monday , killing one and leaving nine others in hospital .
darren osborne , 47 , from cardiff , was arrested after the incident and has been charged with murder and attempted murder .

documents.title: chefs compete for valuable work experience in lincolnshire restaurant
text: it 's our region 's answer to the bbc 's masterchef , and today 13 promising young cooks are battling it out for a place in the final of the copper saucepan competition .
the chefs go head-to-head at hull college preparing a three-course meal for a judging panel .
the top two competitors will compete in the final at the beverley food festival in october , with work experience at a top north lincolnshire restaurant up for grabs .

documents.title: your headlines this morning
text: the latest from the bbc 's newsroom :
author: Sally Fairfax
BBC Radio Humberside News

documents.title: humberside 's new chief constable confirmed
text: the new chief constable of humberside police has been confirmed by the police and crime panel .
lee freeman , who was named as the preferred candidate for the role last month , will take up the role immediately .
the job had been vacant since the former chief constable , justine curran , took early retirement in february .

documents.title: grimsby market traders say bhs closure has hit trade
text: market traders in grimsby say the closure of bhs last year has had a serious impact on their trade .
the department store near top town market closed last august and has been empty ever since .
north east lincolnshire is now encouraging traders to set up stalls at the market .
it has started a new scheme which includes offering reduced rents and incentives for new stallholders .
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: modern slavery partnership says new cases identified
text: a partnership set up to tackle the problem of modern slavery in the humber region , says it is starting to deliver results .
the humber modern slavery partnership was set up two years ago and involves humberside police , four councils , charities and other organisations .
the partnerships says it has identified a number of new cases , where people have been forced work for little or no pay and forced to live in squalid conditions .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: hull square to reopen after £ 25m refurbishment
text: hull 's latest piece of public art will be officially opened today .
trinity square has been re-paved and now features eight large `` mirror pools '' which when filled with water reflect the stained glass windows of hull minster .
hull city council says the square has almost doubled in size after the works , which were part of a £ 25m regeneration of the city centre .
author: Suzy Lawson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : a fine and dry day
text: here 's lisa gallagher with your weather forecast .
good morning east yorkshire and lincolnshire , here 's your forecast
sort it out gallagher , i 'm supposedly off to my little tin hut on wheels this weekend .
must do better
ha ha !
not looking too bad for the weekend ( that is if you compare it to this week and not the lovely weather we have just had ! ! )
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage
text: good morning and welcome to our live coverage on monday 26 june .
i 'm suzy and i 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport , weather and travel updates from across the area until 18:00 .
if you want to get in touch you can .
just send me an email , or a message on facebook or twitter
send me your or any news or info about what 's happening where you are .
author: Suzy Lawson
BBC Local Live
